website_summaries.verdict: A moderately cushioned option for those who need mild to moderate stability.
pros: Midsole provides generous cushioning that won't compress and lose its energy-return properties
Design is fairly wide  and shoe feels stable
There's plenty of midfoot arch support as well
cons: Upper isn't as supportive as some wanted it to be

website_summaries.verdict: These men's running shoes offer unique features and quality support, and they are made in the USA as well.
pros: A top running shoe by a company that is renowned for making quality products that stand the test of time
Solid reputation for arch support and enjoyed by larger runners
cons: Not a lot of change versus prior versions of the 990 series running shoe

customer_reviews.title: The shoes I received were knock offs, not original new balance 990v4
customer_reviews.text: The knock offs are on the left, different color insole is thinner, box is smaller. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting comfort and wear!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely sold to the New Balance 990v, I have them in Black, Red, Blue, White, Gray and now Mustard Yellow! One the best made shoes for people my size! 6’3” 300lbs! Very good shoes for working out and runners or standing long periods! I would like to find that Money Green color I have seen once before! Very Very good purchase! Harold R Craig Greensboro NC
customer_reviews.author: Harold Craig

customer_reviews.title: Super for sensitive knees!
customer_reviews.text: I've only been wearing these V4s for about 4 days but so far they're great. Good lateral support, very comfortable. They serve the specific purpose in my case of cushioning the footfall which under normal circumstances involving street shoes would leave my osteoarthritic knee extremely painful. With these shoes on there is an enormous improvement. So, one can look at a good running shoe not only as a sporting shoe but also as a highly effective protective measure for older people who walk for their exercise. Super!
customer_reviews.author: Bill P. Vienna, VA

customer_reviews.title: These are the worst pair of new balances I have owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst pair of new balances I have owned. My $60 pair 570's are 100% more comfortable. I thought $160 for shoes, they should be nice considering they are USA New Balance, Right???? But no I have bought $30 Sorbothane Shoe insoles and they still hurt my feet. I have had them for one month and they haven't broken in at all. I'm 6'1 and 240 lbs. Not sure WTF New Balance is doing but I guess they are giving up on quality. Crappy Shoes and Broken Quality and Wasted Money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I received a pair of counterfeit shoes. They are ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a pair of counterfeit shoes. They are uncomfortable. The sole has begun to separate. The internal plastic has cracked and makes noise. This is after 2 weeks of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Greatest sneaker EVER!!!for my feet.
customer_reviews.text: New Balance sneakers are the most comfortable, supportive, and durable that I have ever worn. I've been a very happy, loyal fan of NB since April 2010 following an ankle fracture during ice hockey practice. While recovering and looking for suitable footwear, I discovered the 990. Wow, what a shoe....I never looked back. Excellent running shoe and keeps feet and ankles very comfortable all day when on my feet at work during the week. A bit pricey (quality often is), but trust me, I get my money out of these puppies. (My wife will attest to that). I will keep buying these sneakers as long as I have feet that continue to function as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. I chose these because everything in foot locker and stores are garbage or just flat out ugly. The ones that look ok and I settle on have given me heel spurs. So I decided on these because they're made in America and have never heard bad things. Reviews were helpful too so that eased the pain in parting with so much money. After a day of wearing, I ordered another pair because you never know when they will take a good shoe off the market these days and wrap it in Styrofoam for $100+ so you buy more and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: NB 990v4 not authentic
customer_reviews.text: After I received shoes, which actually appeared well-made, I saw a customer review (Old Guy from Texas) that showed photos of knockoffs. Mine had the red and white Made in USA tag like the authentic one but had same stitch detail running from heel to toe under the insole as on his knock-off. I called New Balance and described the stitching and they checked and got back to me saying authentic New Balance 990v4s did not have the stitching detail on the bed of the shoe. Since some customers report shoes falling apart soon and other report that are reasonably durable, I thought maybe the knock-off shoes would not hold up. and returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Oakland CA

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality or knock-off version
customer_reviews.text: These are either factory seconds or knock offs. The stitching is off on the logo, the “made in the USA” is covered by excess fabric, the glue has come loose on the inside, and the lace holes were misaligned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Best shoe out there. My podiatrist recommended this specific model because of my plantar fasciitus. Since wearing this model of shoe (with my custom made insoles) I have had NO issues with it. I highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these (NB-M990V4), The wider width is ideal in creating a comfortable wearing running shoe. Admittedly, I'm not a big runner, but I'm not so old that I don't do some running and walking to stay in decent shape. For me the fit is true to size. I love the fact that these are made in America and perhaps some U.S. worker is benefitting from my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Skip the 990 and get the 1080s.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the 1080v8-9 for about 2 years, getting new ones every 6 months and thought I’d try these and save a few bucks. Plus I like the way these look and when I went to a New Balance store Originally they suggested the 990 or 1080 for me. I only tried the 1080. I also have lower back issues and my shoes make a big difference. Within the first week I knew these 990s were not going to work for me. It’s been 2 months now and my back is hurting all the time. Going back to the 1080, those are great shoes! Bummed I wasted the $ and 2 months with the 990.
customer_reviews.author: ChadbDad

customer_reviews.title: Really nice shoes, but not 990v4's.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice shoes. I've worn New Balance 990's for years, and they always fit and wear well. My last pair were 990v4's, and I really, really liked them. When they started to wear out, I looked to replace them, and found that virtually everyone was selling the newer 990v5's. Amazon listed this seller as having 990v4's in my preferred color and size, so I decided top grab them, despite the relatively high price. What arrived was, of course, a pair of 990v5's. They're only slightly different than the v4, and fit well enough. They'll do fine; but if I'd known that these were v5's, I would not have bought them through this seller and waited for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Oh Happy Feet.
customer_reviews.text: Oh Happy Feet...yea! So far, these shoes are outstanding! There is plenty of room for your toes. Walking and running are pain free. The heel to toe off transition is smooth. This shoe runs 1/2 size large as I had to exchange/return until I got the proper fit (thanks Amazon). New Balance M990V4's are so comfortable you will hardly notice the additional 200 grams of weight compared to other like models. Greatly relieves Plantar Fasciitis pain. I highly recommend these shoes for those who want durable, comfortable working, walking or long distance running shoes. Worth the price, and made in the USA! Way to go New Balance!
customer_reviews.author: vvansuch

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!  The best!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I am glad they are making them in a larger variety of colors. I was getting tired of always wearing grey 990's. This authentic NB shoe fits well and is comfortable on long distance runs. I have worn the 990 series for over 30 years, getting a new pair at least annually. I have worn them in several marathons and am very pleased with the shoe. I have periodically tried other brands and models but always immediately returned to the New Balance 990. For me the New Balance 990 is simply the best running shoe out there.
customer_reviews.author: David Jacob Heino

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of shoes, if a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: I went to a new orthopedist who noted my NB 400's, he's a big NB fan and recommended the 900's. On the whole they're no more comfortable than my 400's but they do look a lot nicer. Next time I see the orthopedist I'm going to inquire as to what he thinks the big deal is. But you can't go wrong with NB, over my 4+ decades of adulthood I've never given any thought to a "tennis shoe" brands but when I started having back problems I sought a better shoe and was fitted with a $150 pair of NB's and couldn't believe how good they were ... now I'm hooked it's the only brand I buy now.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at New Balance
customer_reviews.text: They go on comfortable but the heals are like walking on 2x4 boards, this is not what you want when you have planters faciitis, walking was a all around painful experience. these shoes were not the root cause of my PF I purchased these based on reviews that claimed these were good for PF, but since they lack very good heel cushioning it will only aggravate the condition. so I am now using Brooks Beast 18s, and my PF is on the road to recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: width issues
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were attractive and seemed to be well made. However, even though they were 4E/extra wide, they did not fit my wide (EEE to EEEE) size 11 foot. Looking at others' comments, I think the problem might be in the last of the shoe. Apparently, some are wide, and others not so wide, so a wide shoe width only goes so far to accomodate a wide foot like mine. The other factor is the last on which the shoe is built. So, I would recommend caution for buyers with wide feet. On the plus side, Amazon does have a liberal return policy, and I was able to return them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Randall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fit, excellent style. Buy these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are my 5th pair of 990’s that I’ve purchased so I’m a tad partial to them. First, the color scheme of this pair is beyond reproach. The colors go together so well and flawlessly. The fit is extraordinary, this is why I buy the shoe. I have had four spinal fusions and these shoes literally provide me with relief and a respite from the excruciating pain. I’m, also, 6’2” and 280lbs and these New Balances support me superbly. Yes, there is a newest generation of 990’s out, but there is not one good reason to purchase those over these and for $100 more. I cannot say enough positive things without being able to say anything negative. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USA made [bye bye Nike]
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Made in USA. I changed from Nike to New Balance when Nike took un-American stand with Kapernick commercials and am very happy with my new shoes and new brand!! Comfortable and look like they will be more durable that Nike. Keep up the good work New Balance . Not all New Balance shoes are made in USA but at least some are.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Absolute? Who knows, but these shoes have been keeping my feet going for decades. Outstanding fit, comfort, support, and availability. These are the only running shoes that consistently fit my 4E, 10.5, high instep foot. I walk a couple of miles a day, every day, in every kind of weather, and without these shoes, I would not be able to do that. Thank you New Balance for making a great running shoe in my size. I'm seventy-four years old, so I think everything is ridiculously high priced these days, including these shoes, but given the world we live in, they are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. W,

customer_reviews.title: It's so comfortable and good.
customer_reviews.text: I previously wore the 990 v3 9D, but the length was a bit longer and the width was just right. This time, the 990 V4 8.5 6e is suitable in length and wide, so it is very comfortable and fits better. I think I found a more suitable size for me. For those with wide feet, a wider model with a smaller size would be a good choice. It's very pretty and comfortable, so if these shoes get worn out, I'll buy them again in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: anyone

customer_reviews.title: NB 990v4 & Pedag Viva Sport
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of NB 990v4. They fit perfect and great for running and walking. I always replace the original insoles which are very flimsy without any support, probably made in China. I use Pedag - Viva Sport with excellent shock absorption and semi rigid footbed, they are the best and fit perfect inside these sneakers. Recently purchased a bunch of these insoles on Amazon, just incase they run out. Made in Germany!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Are these knock offs?
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviewers suggesting they were fakes but dismissed this until I received my shoes. They are much lighter than the New Balance I've had before (several pairs) and they were also much more narrow. I like 4E but bought 6E because the 990s are a little more narrow normally. The shoes I received were more like 2E though and just not comfortable. I sent them back within the hour of receiving these. I'd pick something else if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Freestyle Barracuda

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe For Comfort and Support
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of New Balance and I wouldn't buy any other brand. The shoe is well made (In AMERICA), true to size, excellent support, and looks good. I wear my NB shoes daily until I wear them out (usually over 1 1⁄2 years. I keep my old pair to work in the ward and when I go where they will get muddy and wet. Only negative I have is that they are expensive, but then one gets what they pay for.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great for long fast walking
customer_reviews.text: It is a well built shoe. I wear it for long walks And it is sturdy.This is the second pair I have owned.I would purchase it again. I would actually give it 4.5 stars. I would take a half star off only because there are so many shoes with better color combos and this model is rather limited and outside of black which I like,Every other color looks dated. I dont why they cant make “ younger looking “ “Cooler” color combos for this model
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading some reviews online. I was looking for a pair of sneakers I could wear all day and that would be comfortable while giving me the necessary support. I was able to achieve those two things with these New Balance Men's 990v4. I stand and walk on my feet most of my day (8 plus hours a day) and they feel very comfortable, even at the end of a long shift. I also enjoy the support they provide in the arch area and heel. They are also very well made, solid construction. I will probably buy another pair of these or the v5 model next time.
customer_reviews.author: MigasPT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I can only buy New Balance and Dunham Shoes since my feet are so wide. I’ve had atleast 7 pairs of 990 Series shoes, their unbelievable, however the sides wear out rather quickly for me, the mesh spots on the sides. Now that I live in a Warm Climate I only wear them once a week or so, yet the sides wore out. The bottoms, and suede and rest of the shoes look amazing. I spoke to NB and they asked if I could speak to the Retailer I bought them from and NB would make it right, their Customer Service is always amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Brannon worner

customer_reviews.title: So far, love.....
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are terrific. I've been a NB customer for more years than I care to admit. I wear size 12 4E. I've enjoyed great comfort from a few NB models and greatly regretted some others. A 4E width will wear differently depending on the sole and on the material in the upper. In some 4Es my foot sloshes around. When NB stops production of a model that I'm addicted to it can be many trials before I find a comfortable replacement. I'm only one week into these, but they may just be a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Foofoodust

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product, so far!
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear: I like these shoes very much. But they do have a slight problem, in that they are a touch too tight. Now, that may be my fault, for measuring my feet wrong. Or, it may be due to variances in construction techniques. At first, it seemed that I should have ordered a slightly wider fit... which, unfortunately, were not available at the time. However, they also seem to be stretching out. So, depending on how their fit and overall quality ultimately turn out, these shoes may deserve a higher rating. We'll see. For now, I like them. And I would order them again... just a touch wider.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Legit 990’s at a low price!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when i found these shoes for this low price. At the same time, i was concerned that they may be fake. I contacted JUST FIRME and asked them if they are an authorized dealer and they said yes. I looked it up and to sell NEW BALANCE on amazon you have to be authorized. So, i ordered. The box looks genuine and the bar code numbers match up with the shoe. I have not spotted any defects and the shoes feel like the previous 990’s i have had. I do not understand how they sell these at a considerably lower price, but thats good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: and was very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the NB 993 style for last 10 years, and was very satisfied with it. A bit heavy, but really sturdy with good support.But now the 993's are hard to find, (discontinued?) so I decided to try the 990. It feels pretty much the same as the old 993, and I'm happy with it. As some other reviewers have noted, the inserts are rather inadequate, especially if you like good arch support. But a pair of Dr. Scholl's from the drugstore solved that issue.
customer_reviews.author: ronosan

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. First pair lasted twice as long as any other New Balance shoe I've ever had. I walk 10 or miles a day and usually my shoes are done in 6 months or less. These held up for a year and were still not hurting my feet. The tread was actually wearing out, first time I've gotten that much wear out of a pair of shoes. The construction of the shoe is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best New Balance Shoe Made
customer_reviews.text: I wear running shoes nearly all day every day. New Balance has been my goto brand since I have wide feet. I like to have a couple of shoes to rotate around given I live in a humid area with a lot of rain throughout the year. I tried several of the other leather and knit runners from NB and found many far too narrow. The 990 V4 did not make me go up a size in the XXW 11.5 to fit perfectly. About an hour or two break-in removed the initial stiffness. Reasonably light for leather runners.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Martin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Wider...  AND LONGER????
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this particular style is LONGER than my other New Balance shoes that are the exact same size. They feel like an 11.5 size rather than an 11, which is what they're labelled. I can take a snug fitting pair of Superfeet insoles out of my other NB shoes and put them into these new ones, and they definitely slide front to back. That said - They're well made, amazing shoes, just gotta order 1/2 size smaller next time.
customer_reviews.author: Creeks Pub

customer_reviews.title: More pricey than I typically pay but worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a loyal NB sneaker wearer for many years. I’ve been purchasing the same model for a few years now though the version has changed up the version 4 on my last few pair. Unfortunately with the changes I’ve noticed lower comfort and wearing out faster. I decided to try a higher quality sneaker and so far so good. The comfort is excellent with the feel of the padding amazing. Taking high intensity walks good easy on the feet, even with my foot being soar. I believe the cost is a little higher than it should be but I don’t regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: j7469

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the shoe of previous generations
customer_reviews.text: I have owned New Balance 993/990 shoes for many years. I was a little disappointed with the new fit of these, which NB calls Version 4. I generally wear an 8.5 D. For these, I have routinely bought 9 D which gave me a tad more room. I feel they have made these shoes a bit narrower than they used to. I figure (actually hope) these will stretch out a little as I wear them. With previous 993/990 (essentially the same shoe, or are supposed to be) they were comfortable from the moment I put them on. These new shows will take some getting used to and breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Fotoman

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 6-7 pairs of these. They align my foot properly and eliminate foot, knee, and lower back pain. Best shoe I've found to deliver this consistent relief from pair to pair. Just wish they weren't so expensive...I did pick these up for $100 though so can't complain too much. I had purchased some Brookes a couple weeks before ($99) cause these were running $135-$160. When these popped up at $100 I ordered right away. The Brookes are nice so I'll wear those for now and save these...probably actually rotate them so I cannot more life out of them.
customer_reviews.author: I buy stuff

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: My husband was experiencing severe plantar fasciitis pain so I ordered these after reading an article by a podiatrist rating them highly. They were worth the price. He was able to stop using naproxen and creams within the first couple of days. He still uses an inexpensive generic inner sole for extra support while he heals.
customer_reviews.author: Crstin16

customer_reviews.title: Solid running shoe, not marshmellows with shoelaces and made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit -as expected for NB so order your normal NB size from the past. This shoe is a true trainer-its constructed. A trend for the last couple of years has been these super aero marshmallow shoes that frankly almost no one needs. What you loose with those insanely light shoes is structure and the shoe soon lacks support to hold your foot the proper position. Most dont need to save a few onces in our shoes with no plans to win the Boston Marathon. This shoe is solid and comfortable. The material and build quality are excellent. All this and made in the USA...pay the little extra and get a pair of shoes worth what you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great for marathons, and looks just fine fine
customer_reviews.text: I have used the 992 brand from New Balance for over a decade to run marathons, I used to buy 2 of these per year from the store, but now thanks to Amazon I can just get it when needed and I don't trust any other brand but New Balance for long distance. I had a dislocated disk and also a knee injury just over 10 years ago, and since I switched to these sneakers because they are well padded and thick and soft to run, running has never been a problem. I am a not a fast runner, my time is around 5 hours per marathon.
customer_reviews.author: jmurga

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe with Retro Style
customer_reviews.text: First the sizing. These run a little wide. I normally need a wide or EE. The M was the only width available so I took a chance and it works great for me. There is ample room in the toe box. Comfort and support are good for my mild over-pronation. The quality of the materials looks on par or maybe a bit better than other New Balances I bought. I love the look of these dark green shoes which I wear for casual as well.
customer_reviews.author: Teman

customer_reviews.title: Fits to size ordered
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a replacement for a pair of Propet shoes that worn out after awhile and wanted a new shoe line to try. The 11.5 xxwide shoes I ordered fit well for my 11.5 5E foot size. They look really nice and feel good so far on day 1. Update after 6 months. After walking through wet grass a few times I'm now experiencing the bad shoe smell others have mentioned. They still feel great and hold up to wear but even after spraying a few times the smell keeps coming back. Great shoes overall if you can keep them from ever getting damp at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Green

customer_reviews.title: A Qualified Recommendation...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this shoe for many years but find the quality has slipped. The last two pairs failed in the mesh area well before the rest of the shoe was ready and I only use them for extended walking on a tread mill. Really like to support USA manufactures but expect quality at the same time. The front portion is too deep and I have to use an insert to be able to tie tight enough when have the proper length. Eyelets or speed lacing devices would sure help. If this pair holds up I am back to being a happy customer. If not time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: George Doughton

customer_reviews.title: Great support, comfortable and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this New Balance product to replace an old pair of Nikes which had seen better days. Ordered a wide fit for extra room in the toe box which I need because of an arthritic toe starting to make a right turn. Found these sneakers comparable to the Nikes I had which were the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. These New Balance sneakers provide ample support and room for the toes especialy when I am on the eliptical or running on the treadmill. No more friction up front and I feel like I am walking or runninng on an air cushion. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tranacria5131950

customer_reviews.title: The best sneaker on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have a very hard time getting fitted for shoes. These are the only sneakers that allow me to walk/hike for any length of time - because of the support. I have two total knee replacements and two hip replacements .... most people would never know. I know they are a little pricy, but you get what you pay for. I've spent hundreds of dollars trying to find a less expensive sneaker - they all seem to feel good for a short time. NO MORE ... it's been a total waste of money. And ... Amazon has the best price for 990's that I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: PJKerr128

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from this company
customer_reviews.text: The shoes appeared worn previously. This was not disclosed. New Balance shoes are great and I have bought them for over 20 years. Buying direct from NB is the way to go. This distributor is not one to buy from.
customer_reviews.author: rijojosh

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for me, almost
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for walking when new. Only downside is that I supinate - lean over to the outside of my shoe especially on the right side. No shoe seems to last very long that way and these have already started leaning right after about two months use. However, I normally buy NB 928 walkers and when I put a pair of orsippus insoles into what I thought was a worn out pair I had a shoe better than new. I just bought new orsippus insoles for these shoes and we will see how that works out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Richards

customer_reviews.title: On my third pair
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I've just received my third pair. I use them for all purposes (work/office, trail walking and for outdoor chores (mowing, etc.)). Fit might be a bit small (have moved up a half size to get more length). Very well made. Very comfortable. Very durable. Look great. I do remove the insoles upon receipt and replace them with Dr. Scholl's walking insoles, so I can't comment on the insoles that come in the shoes. I've been very satisfied with these shoes, am glad they're made in the USA, and I plan to keep buying them to use as my primary shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Meh -- Used to wear Brooks Beast 14, which are no longer the same, so tried these
customer_reviews.text: These are just okay for my large flat feet that tend to over-pronate. Wish I could still get Brooks Beast 14. (I am 6', 230#, and walk, not jog.) I like that these are said to have been made in USA. (I hope that is true.) There is a lot of suede on these shoes and it is difficult to keep it looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Love New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the gym so I'm currently wearing them only inside, but I can tell they'd be good on the road as well. Good support and the shoe is very substantial. I wear a 15B in dress shoes but have generally gone up to a 16B in running and cross trainers. I don't run anymore but I do speed walk on the track so I need that toe room to prevent stubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you're buying at far cheaper prices!
customer_reviews.text: Beware if you're buying shoes at much cheaper prices. Seller doesnt seem on the level in all cases. Product was different from the pictures. Label on the back was different and the shoes were 1 size different from eachother. One was 13 and the other was 12.5. I have read the products here are sketchy for many people. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Chevalier

customer_reviews.title: Mountain tested
customer_reviews.text: Made in America. By Americans. Brilliant shoe. 4th pair of this type. Bought them and took an unscheduled road trip from Massachusetts to Montana. This shoe climbed 6 -8k peaks 70mi of National Wilderness hiking boot replacement if you have welded ankles like me. A little iffy when we had to break out the ice axe as far as a crampon substitute, but clung like spiderman on the car sized boulders.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sold me a knock off!
customer_reviews.text: I knew the price was too good but I ordered it anyway. Rather than a great buy, I got a very good knock off. I didn't send them back, I am wearing them and they are ok but I won't be buying 990's or any other shoe from Amazon again. I've lost faith in them selling what they advertise. Had these been sold as knock offs I never would have bought them. I do feel a bit ripped off, rather than having gotten a "good deal".
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Nice they half sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 1/2 B width, flat, thin feet. I like New Balance because they provide more than C or D width! My last pair of NB only had full 11/12/13 choices and I always wear a groove in the back of 12's and trip over 13's. These seem to fit well. They look good and so far so good. I have flat feet and need a good bold arch - these are marginal, I may need to get an insert, we'll see...
customer_reviews.author: sadsack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for running and speed-walking, made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of 990v4 New Balance shoes and I like them a lot. If I was a REALLY serious runner I would probably opt for something lighter but these are excellent, comfortable and stable for speed-walking my 5K route in the mornings. I do a little running in them too, just 1 mile at time. Another thing I like is that they are, for the most part, made in the USA which is a factor in all my clothing purcheses.
customer_reviews.author: M. Burnham

customer_reviews.title: All good, except the price
customer_reviews.text: The EE width shoes are attractive and nicely fit my wide feet. I use a custom insert, and it fits perfectly. But the shoe does age a bit prematurely. Maybe related is that, after a year my wearing the same version of shoe, that the sole material seems to decompose, emit a chemical smell, and lose supporting shape. Not so bad, it's nice to get a fresh pair of shoes. But the price seems high for an annual pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: STEM Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've worn New Balance shoes for more than two decades, and this latest pair doesn't disappoint. I wear them for fairly easy aerobic exercising and they offer good support for my old feet and bad knees. They were tight before stretching out a bit with wear, and are more comfortable than when brand new, but it might have been better to order a half size larger. As it is, they do what I want them to do, and being made in the US is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Nahkhii

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my ancient 991s
customer_reviews.text: These probably are a good shoe, better than my 4* rating except they are the latest version of the original 991s that made me fall in love with NB. They are stiff as heck and could have more arch support. They are taking forever to break in but they are finally getting comfortable. I got them for half price and if I had paid full price, they would ahve gone back. Not worth $140!
customer_reviews.author: Dean  G

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for painful feet.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable pair of shoes I have owned in the last decade plus. I have now purchased 3 pairs in the last 2 plus years. Suffering with Plantar fasciitis for the last two decades has made shoe purchases somewhat disappointing. I have and will buy more of this product. Great feeling, looking and enjoyable to wear. My only disappointment with this pair of shoes is that both shoes had small eraser sized holes in the tongues where tongue attached to the shoe. I almost sent them back but my size 9 4e are very limited. I hope this issue is not a problem and I get a reasonable amount of wear. Overall I am satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Dr. ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I have foot problems and am a diabetic. My Podiatrist is sending me to be fitted with inserts. In the meantime She said I could buy a pair of USA made New Balance. I have always worn New Balance but being a cheap son of a gun, they were always the imported. I have never spent this much on a pair of "sneakers". But now I am thinking maybe I should have and wouldn't going through the pain I have.... That being said they are 100% worth it
customer_reviews.author: W. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great, just eh.
customer_reviews.text: They're ok. Nothing to write home about. I am afraid they could be counterfeit because based off the one reviewer's photos the pair I got look similar but have a different box. The SKUs all match up with the numbers on the tongue, box, and QR code. They're not as comfortable as I hoped they are and do feel a little goofy on my feet. I would suggest ordering a size down if you order a wide. Not bad just not as great as I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Just like all versions of the 990's before them, these are great shoes. This is my 10th pair of 990 style, and I couldn't live without them. I work on my feet in a hospital all day, and I developed plantar fasciitis. Without the 990 series I would never have made it this long. Perfect amount of support and cushion to stand all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Men's Sports Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a well made and attractive men's sports/walking shoe. This one is perfect. Made in the USA and all the details show it. Structure is very solid and keeps foot properly aligned with no side-to-side slipping. Lacing is advanced with more than normal number of eyelets. You can use two eyelets at the top to make sure you have a solid lacing across the top of the arch.
customer_reviews.author: JCooJr

customer_reviews.title: Best Stability Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Love the made in the USA New Balance 990s. 3rd pair and they are the best training shoe. I rotate these with Brooks Ghost but these are far more durable and better for training at the gym. I hope NB keeps making these in the USA because I will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exact match of the 990v4 shoes I bought new at a New Balance Store a year or two ago
customer_reviews.text: A couple of people said they got shoes that were knock offs, but I was replacing the exact model, color and size of the 990v4's I bought new at a New Balance store when the 990v4's were being sold there. The shoes I got was identical in every way! So instead of driving to the store and seeing if the 990v5's were going to be as good of a fit and look as my 990v4's, I got these at a reduced price from what the 990v5's are being sold for. I've worn them for a couple of days and I am positive these are not knock offs! I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: cegfromsat

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues.
customer_reviews.text: I normally love new balance shoes, but this last pair has been ridiculous. After about a month of wearing these, the soles have begun peeling off. I’m a truck driver, so they don’t exactly get abused. For $180 a pair, I’m pretty pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I'll make quality updates
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this shoe due to declining quality issues with this line over the past 10 years but my last Chinese shoes were toast and their new replacement version is just glued together without any stitching and expensive as well. I decided to go back to these. They do run around 2 sizes large so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: WE-2

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend a pair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shoe to help my husband's balance problems. Their broad bottom gives him a larger area over which to distribute his weight. He has neuropathy and does not always walk straight nor realize that he is not doing so. The New Balance shoes give him less of a chance of stumbling/ This is his first pair of NB and he immediately fells the difference! I would definitely recommend a pair.
customer_reviews.author: bentley's jojo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bunions!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable shoe I've ever had. My size is 8.5 4E. Since I've bunion deformity problem, 4E is my one and only option. I already knew NB is the best in 4E sizes but I haven't tried M990 until my son told me that his teacher is wearing one of these who also has a bunion problem and very happy with them. This is my second day with my shoes and today I needed to wear them about 10 hours as I'm travelling and I felt nothing but healing. Thanks to my son and thanks to you NB!
customer_reviews.author: Aye

customer_reviews.title: Been buying this model for years
customer_reviews.text: Very well made (USA) sneaker. Very good support and stability. Have been buying this model for the past few years, have almost every color they make. Can’t wear them out! I replace the inner cushions every year or so. I use them for walking, especially on trips and vacations we take, can wear all day and walk many miles without fatigue. Will continue to purchase as long as they are made, or newer version comes out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Greatest shoe made for heavy runners!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this model for years and usually get a new pair every two years. This is the absolutely, positively,best shoe on the market for heavy runners or walkers. My podiatrist recommends this shoe for all his patients. Made in USA is an added bonus.Heavy runners - stop wasting money on cheaper shoes that were made for little skinny runners. This shoe is the real deal!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Blore

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Overall
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing them for about week now. The fit has been great. They are comfortable. Heavier than a regular running shoes than I am used to. You feel firm and planted while walking. The actual insole could have some more support. I was using Dr Scholls Plantar Fasciitis in my previous shoe that I will putting in these, since I've had some arch and foot pains. Overall great product. I look to buy more to wear on different days.
customer_reviews.author: TheAwesomeReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good solid shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good solid shoes. The only complaint I have is they seem a little too big across the top of the toe. What I mean is that the fabric seems a little baggy. The fit is good, my foot is snug and comfortable. Tons of very reflective bits make these highly visible at night. Workmanship and quality are great, expect them to last a long time. Like that they are made in the US.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: If you have a high instep and need arch support
customer_reviews.text: New Balance provides the best arch support and is the best shoe to prevent pronation. If you have a wide foot, the 4 W is essential. I used to get blisters between my toes with my old shoes. I checked these out with my podiatrist and he said they were a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: SAM MIHALIK

customer_reviews.title: If you like squeaky shoes!
customer_reviews.text: If you like squeaky shoes this ones for you. I've had many pairs of New Balance over the years. The last two that I had were foam models and they squeaked like an old screen door. I bought these because it didn't say they were foam but that old squeaky screen door is still there. Since I only wear them on the treadmill I kept them, otherwise I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Good Medicine for Your Knees, As Well As Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a date— who happened to be a physical therapist— I had my first pair fitted at a store that did a computer analysis of my foot, gait, pace, etc. I did this as I was having knee pain. These shoes plus the SuperFeet that I also ordered were PERFECT “medicine” for addressing my knee pain. After about 3 weeks, my knees had recovered 75% by then. Now almost a year later, I am pain free. Anyway, these were replacement/additional shoes. BTW, I walk about 3-4 miles a day as a part of my job....
customer_reviews.author: Evan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Only 70% USA "origin"
customer_reviews.text: Hard to buy American made shoes. That's why I've bought NB for decades. Now only a minor few of NB shoes benifit American manufacturing. Was slightly disappointed in that the label that was attached to these said 70% USA origin...pretty vague...I paid more for the privilege of supporting our struggling American workers and would have been even more happy to do so had it been 100% USA.
customer_reviews.author: CitCane

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is incorrect/much too tight...cannot use
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing New Balance shoes for more years than I care to remember (many decades). I always wear a 10.5/M shoe. I've just received a new pair of NB990 v4 and they are NOT the correct size. The box says 10.5. The label in the shoes says 10.5 but they are much smaller. I made a mistake and wore them (jogged about 7 miles) twice thinking they would loosen up. They have not and I'm very disappointed B/C I can't return them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Fit and Feel Are Superb
customer_reviews.text: I buy New Balance because they are so comfortable. These 990v4 shoes are no different. I use them to work on a concrete-base floor a couple of days a week and I'm on my feet just about the whole time. At the end of the day, my feet are tired, for sure, but they aren't sore and I can still go after work. More importantly, My feet are in good shape the next morning. I definitely recommend these shoes. Their size is a true size. I wear size 10 D (medium) and that's what I order. They are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chucker

customer_reviews.title: Not for people with feet issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes because many reviews stated that these are great for plantar fasciitis. This is an issue that I have dealt with for a while and was actually finally recovering from it. The shoes were a great fit and comfortable out of the box. However, a month into using them on the treadmill, I redeveloped the plantar fasciitis pain on my left foot. I'm completely frustrated because I feel like this has set me back to the beginning of dealing with this problem. I do not recommend these for anyone dealing with feet issues.
customer_reviews.author: 502LOU

customer_reviews.title: I've been running on New Balance ...
customer_reviews.text: ... probably longer than you've been alive! I have a wide foot but a narrow heel, and NB's widths accommodate my foot very well. I have both running shoes and court shoes in the "EE" width and I love them. A set of 990's lasts me a year, running on pavement. Never change, NB!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Paseur

customer_reviews.title: Lovers of 990v3, be advised
customer_reviews.text: I have had many New Balance 990v3 shoes over the years and they have always fit perfectly if I order 1/2 size over my normal shoe size. I ordered the v4 for the first time and found them tight and uncomfortable in the toe box, so much so I had to return them. If you are a lover of the v3, you may find the v4 shoes do not fit as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My son's favorite sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 14 year old son. He loves the extra arch support and the cushiony insole. I thought they were bulkier and heavier than his NIkes, but he says that they are much more comfortable. I have to say he picks these from his closet more than any other brand. The quality is good and he wore his last pair until they became too small.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SUPPORT SHOE
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing the 990/993 series 20 years ago when I had a tendon problem in my foot. It helped the tendon to heal and I have not had a problem since. These are the best shoes for support and walking. They last a long time when you take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie R Gates

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bulky w/ little cushion
customer_reviews.text: This is the first running shoe that gave me something to complain about. First, they are kind of clunky, but I thought I needed a bigger base because I'm a bigger guy, but they didn't last long and now I have heel pain for the first time in my life. I realize this may or may not be from the shoe, but these are the first shoes than I never got comfortable with and ended up with foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: BEDo3

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: New Balance brings out a new model of these shoes every year. This one, though, works especially well on my feet. When I learned that it was being discontinued, I came online and bought two pair. The only downside: As NB sells off the last of these shoes, the selection of colors narrows. The one I really wanted was sold out. My advice: Act fast!
customer_reviews.author: William Coe

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have been wearing Nike exclusively for almost forever like the Air Torch and a few others. I can't believe the difference in support and comfort with these sneakers! I am a fan and honestly don't think I am ever going back to Nikes. Like other reviewers I like the fact they are made in the USA and the quality really shows unlike the made in China or Vietnam Nikes. These are really worth every red cent! Buy them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laser Show

customer_reviews.title: My one and only sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying the 990s for the last 3 years, I’m on my 4th pair and I don’t ever need another sneaker. I have Plantar Fasciitis and walk 2-3 miles a day for recreation. A combination of these and the green superfeet insoles along with calf stretches has nipped that issue in the bud most days. They really last long and are worth the top dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Balbanes

customer_reviews.title: Great support lateral and frontal and deep toe box as well great shock absorption.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot buy a better shoe for running and cross training. This model is one of the few shoes that has a deep toe box. You can add thick custom orthotics and additional polyurethane padding
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: The soles were so stiff I barely got 1/2 a mile before my feet had cramped up. I had to limp home. If you need/like stiff soles so you can feel every bit of shock echo from your feet through your shoulders then these bad boys are just right for you! That being said I’ve owned a pair of New Balance running shoes and I currently own two pairs of NB sneakers for just lounging around and I loved/love those. So like the mouse who doesn’t learn from his mistakes I’m probably going to try another pair, but a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Ricochete

customer_reviews.title: none better
customer_reviews.text: Theses are the best shoes Ive ever worn and let me tell you, Ive worn all the other shoe brands and none compare to these in my opinion. Ive been wearing new balance shoes for over fifteen years.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Lenett

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I could not pay full price for this shoe but was able to buy it slightly used. It is a sturdy, American made shoe I use mostly for walking. After having a couple pair of cheap sneakers, these are a big improvement. Great support. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: floyd

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe. Took a week or so to break in but after that they are great. They are the last sneaker made in the USA. I am far from a runner but needed good support as my left foot tends to hurt from a broken leg years ago. This sneaker helps and very comfy. Don't think you have to be a runner to enjoy there 990's as they look like any other NB shoe I have owned. Your feet will thank you. I have read that this is one of the last USA made sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ferry

customer_reviews.title: Only real shoe that lasts.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the only shoe that actually feels as expensive as it costs. I have purchased very expensive shoes in the past that just felt very flimsy and only lasted about a month or two before the glue started giving up. These shoes have the perfect stiffness, bounce, fitment, and actully lasts. Try twisting any other very expensive gym shoe at a shoe store, they can twist very easy at least a quarter way around and can even start falling appart right way. Then try twisting these shoes, you can tell the difference right away. I am very happy with these and ..... MADE IN THE USA.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is now a second pair that has fallen apart in less than a month. I'm not even going to ask for a replacement; not worth it. The sole keeps detatching from the upper part. Both pairs in the same spot. This is riduculous for a $150 pair of shoes that I'm just using for walking. Who knows what happens when you actually run in these! 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Egor P.

customer_reviews.title: V4 better than expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews stating that the v3 were a better shoe than the newer v4 , i was a little hesitant to purchase the newer v4. I have been wearing the v3 for the past year or so, everyday walking/ running 3-4 miles daily. I decided to try the newer v4 and much to my surprise, I actually prefer the v4 over the v3. A little more cushion, but basically the same shoe. I guess it's an individual preference, but I definitely prefer the newer v4. Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: F. Takashima

customer_reviews.title: Stopped the constant leg and ankle aches
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a man with constant ankle and leg pain. They have given him the additional support needed without looking like shoes for the aged. He likes the look and the comfort of this style New Balance. Has 2 pair in different colors. Really like the suede as it gives a slightly dressier look. Would buy again, because the comfort factor offsets the price.
customer_reviews.author: P. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, support, value for your money, Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I really like this model. Made in USA which is important to me. New Balance is NOT associated with ingrates who don't respect our country&the sacrifice thousands have made to keep our Republic. I like the all-day comfort support&stability of these shoes. The sole is non-marking yet long wearing. I have several pairs purchased over several years. Version 4 is the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: S4 Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: A little heal heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking and quality shoes that are built to last. My complaint is the heal material seems a little heavy when you walk. It seems to make you walk on your heals. Once you get used to it its OK but there is defiantly a need to improve the shape of the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall_Mathers_IV

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Made in Us 990 V4 Sneaker
product_meta.description: The latest in our Made in USA series, the 990v4 provides the perfect blend of cushioning and stability. With a hybrid upper for breathability and ENCAP technology for comfort, this classic running shoe continues our legacy of great performance and iconic style.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
Lace up running shoe featuring breathable mesh upper with supportive leather overlays
Blown rubber outsole; Dual density collar foam
ENCAP PU ring with EVA core in heel
ENCAP PU Ring with EVA Core
Medicare/HSPCS Code = PDAC A5500 Diabetic Shoes
